content:
Pappardelle is an excellent choice! The wide, flat noodles will hold onto the rich and savory coffee-based sauce perfectly. The rough texture of pappardelle will also help to trap the flavors of the sauce, ensuring every bite is coated in that delicious coffee-infused goodness.

Pappardelle is a traditional Italian pasta shape that originates from Tuscany, which makes it a great match for the Italian-inspired flavors in the coffee-based sauce. The wide noodles will also allow you to enjoy the tender, fall-apart beef in big, satisfying bites.

If you want to take it up a notch, consider adding some sautéed mushrooms, such as cremini or shiitake, to the dish. The earthy flavor of the mushrooms will complement the coffee and beef beautifully, creating a hearty and satisfying winter-inspired pasta dish.

Other pasta shapes that could work well with this sauce include:

* Tagliatelle: Similar to pappardelle, but a bit narrower, tagliatelle will still hold onto the sauce nicely.
* Rigatoni: A tubular pasta shape that will trap the sauce inside, ensuring every bite is flavorful.
* Fettuccine: A flat, wide noodle made from egg and flour, fettuccine will add a richness to the dish and pair nicely with the coffee flavors.

Ultimately, the choice of pasta shape is up to personal preference. But if you're looking for a traditional Italian pairing, pappardelle is an excellent choice.
